Package game.world

Class ControlMapInitialise

java.lang.Object
game.world.ControlMapInitialise
public class ControlMapInitialise extends Object
The ControlMapInitialise class is responsible for managing and initializing game maps and game state in the text-based game. It provides methods for resetting maps, adding and clearing enemy lists, and handling player respawns. This class is part of the game.world package and is designed for use within the game engine.

    • addInitMap

      public static void addInitMap(AllGameMapsEnum mapName, InitialiseGameMap initMap)
      Adds an initialization map for a specific game map to the initMaps collection.
      Parameters:
      mapName - The enum representing the game map.
      initMap - The InitializeGameMap object associated with the game map.

    • resetAll

      public static void resetAll(GameMap oldMap)
      Resets all game maps to their initial state and clears the enemy list.
      Parameters:
      oldMap - The previous game map to be reset.

    • addEnemy

      public static void addEnemy(Actor enemy)
      Adds an enemy actor to the enemy list.
      Parameters:
      enemy - The enemy actor to be added.

    • clearEnemyList

      Clears the enemy list.

    • respawn

      public static void respawn(Actor player, GameMap map)
      Respawns the player character and manages the lost runes item.
      Parameters:
      player - The player character (Actor).
      map - The game map where the player is respawned.
